item.title: 2023-05-25T18:41:15
item.description:
Android 14 Beta 2.1 bugfix has been released.

Fixed issues:

â€¢ Battery percentage could still display as 0% regardless of the device's actual charge level.
â€¢ Issues that sometimes caused audio disruptions with the device's speakers.
â€¢ System stability issues that could cause apps or the device to freeze or crash.
â€¢ An Issue with always-on-display mode when using a device with Android Auto.
â€¢ Google Photos app could crash when trying to open certain photos.
â€¢ An Issue with Google TV app that caused the PiP window to disappear when switching to picture-in-picture mode with gesture navigation turned on, although playback continued and sound was audible.
â€¢ An Issue that caused the Google Contacts app to crash when managing account settings.
â€¢ An Issue where the Google Messages app icon did not appear in notifications if Always-on-display mode was enabled.

Build: UPB2.230407.014 â†’ UPB2.230407.019
Patch: May 2023

â€¢ OTAs
â€¢ Factory Images

ðŸ”— Register for Android beta testing

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-24T18:49:44
item.description:
A bunch of new upcoming changes to the Google Contacts app:

â€¢ Redesigned Call, Text, etc. buttons, which are now presented as a circle with an icon inside.
â€¢ A new 'Google Maps Â· Location sharing' tile, which when clicked will open a map with the contact's location (if they have shared the location with you).
â€¢ A new tile will appear on the 'Highlights' tab with Suggestions for who to add to your favorites. As stated, this is "based on who you interact with most".

These hidden features complement the previous changes I discovered, such as the time and weather tile by contact's home address and the new round-frame photo display.

All of these new features are built inside the latest version 4.9.19.533509922 and require only server-side activation (means, they are not yet available).

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-24T07:00:46
item.description:
Google Chrome on Android begins work on a transparent navigation bar.

In one of the latest Chrome Canary builds, there is a new "DrawEdgeToEdge" flag, whose description says, "Enables the Android feature Edge-to-Edge to draw below the Nav Bar". After enabling this flag, the Android navigation gesture bar finally becomes transparent, as many users have requested.

But as stated in the corresponding commit on Chromium Gerrit, this is a basic implementation that is not
a suite for launch but fine for a Dev demo.

From personal observations, I can say that the transparency only affects the home and web pages, while the settings, bookmarks, etc. are still unchanged. It is also accompanied by unintentional gesture pill overlap on sites with bottom navigation bars, and the top bars are overlapped by the status bar by the height of the navbar.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-19T20:51:24
item.description:
Hands-on: I finally got this fully working, so here's a full demo of Android 14's new partial screen recording feature.

This feature lets you record a single app without any System UI elements or notifications appearing in the video! A useful feature to have when you need to screen record something to share with others!

(In the app selector dialog, you can swipe up to show the full app list. You can also swipe left or right on the carousel to show more apps from your recents app list.)

EDIT:

If you leave the app you selected to record, then Android will continue screen recording but the content will be black. If you open the app again, the contents will once again be captured in the same recording.

The recording doesn't end unless you swipe down and end it manually.

item.title: 2023-05-19T13:30:21
item.description:
Android 14 will allow you to 'save app pair' shortcut.

As Mishaal Rahman discovered, Android 14 Beta 2 added a new ENABLE_APP_PAIRS developer flag to the Pixel Launcher. If you turn it on, you will be able to 'save app pair' of two apps in split screen mode from the context menu in recents overview.

Most likely, after that a corresponding shortcut will appear on the home screen, and when you click on it, it will open the previously saved pair of apps in split-screen mode.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-18T12:40:14
item.description:
The first live video of the Pixel 8 Pro showing off the new thermometer feature has been leaked.

Kuba Wojciechowski (via 91 Mobiles) has shared a video of the Pixel 8 Pro that reveals the full design of the phone, as well as demonstrating the thermometer feature.

From a previous Pixel 8 Pro renders leak, we remember that there was an unknown sensor underneath the flash. As it turns out, it's a special infrared temperature measurement sensor. This sensor is similar to the one used in most non-contact thermometers. In the video we can see a clear demonstration of how this would work.

In addition to measuring body temperature, the Pixel 8 Pro will be able to measure the temperature of objects. The collected data will be stored locally, and it will be processed through Android Private Compute Core.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-18T11:09:55
item.description:
Android 14 will improve drag-and-drop text and media between apps.

Until now, to drag a text or media file from one app to another, you had to open them in split screen mode. And you couldn't use system navigation while dragging an object.

It looks like Android 14 will refine this point, and you'll be able to grab an object in one app, go back to the homescreen or open the recents overview, open another app and paste that object there without having to go into split-screen mode.

*Yeah, just like iOS*

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-17T22:23:05
item.description:
Port of live wallpaper from Google Pixel Fold for phones.

â€¢ Author: @trzpro (via Xiaomiui resource)

â€¢ Demo

Notes:
â€¢ You may face Google Play Protect window pop up with a suspicious app warning.
â€¢ The wallpaper does not rotate to landscape mode.
â€¢ Don't expect any magic or smoothness, as this is a port from a folding device, where the progress of the animation depends on the angle of folding the device.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-17T22:21:07
item.description:
The live wallpaper from the Google Pixel Fold has been ported to phones.

The Google Pixel Fold come out of the box with a set of "Feathers" live wallpapers, which consists of two options: Porcelain and Licorice.

Developer @trzpro (via Xiaomiui resource) has successfully ported it for phones. APK goes next post.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-17T10:19:50
item.description:
Soon you will be able to use your Pixel as a Dashcam.

Google has apparently accidentally posted Dogfood version of Personal Safety app v.2023.04.27.532191641.8-dogfood, which contains a hidden 'Dashcam' feature.

Your phone will record video for up to 24 hours, the recording can be interrupted at any time. While recording, you can continue to use your phone, or lock it to save power.

The average video size will be 30MB per minute. Unsaved videos will be automatically deleted after a configurable retention period (1 day, 3 days, 1 week).

You will also be able to automatically set the recording to start when connected to your car's Bluetooth system and choose whether or not to record audio.

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-17T09:04:12
item.description:
Google will delete personal accounts inactive for 2 years.

Starting later this year (December 2023), if a Google account has not been used and logged in for at least 2 years, Google can delete the account and its content, including content in Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Drive, Meet, Calendar), YouTube and Google Photos.

This policy applies only to personal Google accounts and does not affect accounts of organizations, such as schools or businesses.

Before the account is deleted, the company will send several notifications in the months leading up to the deletion to both the account's primary and backup email address.

The easiest way to keep your Google account active is to log in at least once every 2 years. You can also sign up for a subscription set up through your Google Account, which would also count as activity.

ðŸ”— Google Blog

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-16T21:55:45
item.description:
Android 13 QPR3 Beta 3.2 bugfix is out.

Build number: T3B3.230413.006 â†’ T3B3.230413.009
Security patch: May 2023

Release Notes:
â€¢ Fixed an input synchronization issue with the system UI that caused windows to stop receiving touch input or to receive touch input in the wrong location. (Issue #279560321)
â€¢ Fixed an issue that could cause calls over Wi-Fi to disconnect unexpectedly.
â€¢ Fixed issue that could prevent a SIM card from being detected properly or from being activated during phone setup.
â€¢ Fixed an issue where a device could fail to register IMS over Wi-Fi when leaving LTE coverage and entering Wi-Fi coverage.
â€¢ Fixed issues that caused unexpected dips with cellular connectivity speeds or reliability.

ðŸ”— OTA images
ðŸ”— Factory Images

Google News | En

item.title: 2023-05-16T16:17:17
item.description:
What customization options will appear in Android 14?

At the Google I/O company showed off new ways to personalize your Android phone that were hinted at in past builds:

â€¢ Lock screen Clock customization
You'll have a choice of several watch face options with the ability to customize their color and size.

â€¢ Lock screen shortcuts customization
 You will be able to select the following shortcuts: Flashlight, Do Not Disturb, Camera, Smart Home Control, Wallet, QR Code Scanner (maybe something else).

â€¢ Emoji wallpaper
It will be possible to customize the combination of emoji, their pattern and colors. The wallpaper will also respond to taps.

â€¢ Cinematic wallpapers
You will be able to create a wallpaper from your photos with a parallax effect.

â€¢ AI Wallpaper Generator
You will be able to create your own wallpaper based on a text query using Googleâ€™s text-to-image diffusion model.

ðŸ”— Google Blog

Google News | En
